intro: Hydrostachys rutenbergii, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in desert ecosystems.
